      • getPathsInFunctionExpr

        public Map<LogicalExpression,Set<SchemaPath>> getPathsInFunctionExpr()
        Suppose the index key has functions (rather than plain columns): CAST(a as int), CAST(b as varchar(10)), then we want to maintain a mapping of the logical expression of that function to the schema path of the base column involved in the function. In this example map has 2 entries: CAST(a as int) --> 'a' CAST(b as varchar(10)) --> 'b'
        Specified by:
        getPathsInFunctionExpr in interface FunctionalIndexInfo
        Returns:
        the map of indexed expression --> the involved schema paths in a indexed expression

      • getExprMap

        public Map<LogicalExpression,LogicalExpression> getExprMap()
        Specified by:
        getExprMap in interface FunctionalIndexInfo
        Returns:
        the map between indexed expression and to-be-converted target expression for scan in index e.g. cast(a.b as int) -> '$0'

      • allNewSchemaPaths

        public Set<SchemaPath> allNewSchemaPaths()
        Specified by:
        allNewSchemaPaths in interface FunctionalIndexInfo
        Returns:
        the set of all new field names for indexed functions in index

      • allPathsInFunction

        public Set<SchemaPath> allPathsInFunction()
        Specified by:
        allPathsInFunction in interface FunctionalIndexInfo
        Returns:
        the set of all schemaPath exist in functional index fields

      • supportEqualCharConvertToLike

        public boolean supportEqualCharConvertToLike()
        Description copied from interface: FunctionalIndexInfo
        Whether this implementation( may be different per storage) support rewrite rewriting varchar equality expression, e.g. cast(a.b as varchar(2)) = 'ca' to LIKE expression: cast(a.b as varchar(2) LIKE 'ca%'
        Specified by:
        supportEqualCharConvertToLike in interface FunctionalIndexInfo
